vote.title: The immediate risk of mass starvation in Gaza and the attacks on humanitarian aid deliveries
vote.label: Motions for resolutions: RC-B9-0187/2024, B9-0186/2024, B9-0187/2024, B9-0189/2024, B9-0190/2024, B9-0191/2024, B9-0192/2024

voting.title: Joint motion for a resolution RC-B9-0187/2024 (PPE, S&D, Renew, Verts/ALE)
Motion for a resolution (as a whole)
voting.label: RC-B9-0187/2024 – Motion for a resolution (text as a whole)

part.partValue: ‘Expresses deep concern about the catastrophic humanitarian situation in Gaza, including the risk of imminent starvation, the spread of diseases and the confirmed deaths of children due to malnutrition and dehydration; is concerned about aid deliveries in unsafe conditions; underlines the urgent need for rapid, safe and unhindered humanitarian access; urges the Israeli authorities again to reopen the Rafah, Kerem Shalom, Karmi and Erez crossings;’
‘recognises the indispensable role of UNRWA in the region;’
‘Calls on the European External Action Service and the Commission to review Israel’s compliance with its obligations under the EU-Israel Association Agreement;’
‘calls on the Commission and Council to suspend the EU-Israel Association Agreement in view of Israel’s repeated breaches of international humanitarian law and international human rights law;’
Text as a whole without the deletion of the word: ‘immediate’ and the word ‘Israeli’ (two occurrences)
deletion of: ‘immediate’
‘Israeli’ (first occurrence)
‘Israeli’ (second occurrence)

vote.title: Creation of a European initiative for an annual designation of European capitals for children
vote.label: Motion for a resolution: B9-0174/2024

voting.title: Motion for a resolution B9-0174/2024 (PPE, S&D, Renew, Verts/ALE, The Left)
Motion for a resolution (as a whole)

part.partValue: ‘Calls on the Commission to explore the possibility of creating a European initiative to annually designate European Capitals of Children,’
‘in collaboration with local authorities and civil society organisations led by or working with children;’
Text as a whole without the words: ‘with the participation of children and prioritising their perspectives,’
those words

‘Believes that the European Capitals of Children could contribute to the fight against child poverty, a comprehensive examination of children’s living conditions and the effective implementation of the European Child Guarantee by Member States by making full use of the available resources at national and EU level; believes that this could be achieved through the exchange of best practices among civil society, in particular children’s organisations, parents, cities, local governments and Member States, and with the involvement of all relevant stakeholders;’
‘reiterates its call for an urgent increase in funding for the European Child Guarantee, with a dedicated budget of at least EUR 20 billion;’

remarkFreeText.translation: Tomáš Zdechovský had withdrawn his support from joint motion for a resolution RC-B9-0187/2024. Ewa Kopacz had also supported motion for a resolution B9-0174/2024.
